117.heading: Baseball Teams.
117.title: The Golem's Mighty Swing
117.author: by James Sturm.
notes: "Set in the 1920s, this compelling picture novel tells the story of the Stars of David, a Jewish baseball team. These bearded barnstormers roam the country taking on local squads and attracting curious patrons. When the team's season is threatened they bring to life a golem, a legendary Jewish creature that they hope will deliver them from their trials. The Golem's Mighty Swing is a classic American baseball story"
back cover.

179.author: argumento, Yolanda Vargas Dulch√© ; dibujo, Sixto Valcia B
notes: SUMMARY: In the house of correction, Carlos doesn't know if his mother is alive or not. A guard is killed in an escape attempt and the warden thinks Carlos did it. Carlos is put in a straight jacket and whipped by the warden. The warden then gets evidence that Carlos did not kill the guard, but decides to hide the evidence and hold Carlos incommunicado. The prison nurse knows the truth and promises to try and get word to Carlos's mother and friends. Meanwhile Ernesto, Ricardo and Mem√≠n come to the institution on visiting day but are denied access to Carlos. Mem√≠n sees a laundry chute and jumps in, landing in the prison's basement.

180.heading: Basements.
180.title: "It's All Arranged"
180.author: King.
notes: Summary: Walt gives Hank liquor in the basement, and Hank says to forget about the speeding ticket.

181.heading: Basements.
181.title: "The Moat"
181.author: [No author]
181.series: Andy Panda) 8 p. in New Funnies, no. 98
notes: Summary: Charlie Chicken notices muddy water in the pipes, so Andy opens a pipe and floods the basement. They go outside to find the water main and shut it off, but end up digging all the way around the house before they accidentally break the main pipe. They end up with a moat, so they build a drawbridge. The mailman falls in, then two policemen, and a law librarian finds a law from the year 1591 against moats. By the time research is done and the police return, Andy and Charlie have filled in the moat. The tap water is still muddy.

182.heading: Basements.
182.title: "Mom Wants to Know What You Think You're Doin' Down Here"
182.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: In the darkened basement, smoke rises from a a toaster and Mr. Mitchell is at the fuse box.
Strip is a rerun from 1975, while Ketcham recovers from surgery.

183.heading: Basements.
183.title: "The Parenting Advantages of Dentists"
183.author: Larson.
notes: Summary: Go to the basement and wait in the chair, it's time for one of our "appointments." Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Dental appointments"

184.heading: Basements.
184.title: "Relax! Clovia and I Took Care of Him Hours Ago!"

notes: Summary: After putting the pup in the basement, Skeezix later worries he might be too cold.

185.heading: Basements.

notes: Summary: The girls gloat over the basement full of 'woman-haters.'

186.heading: Basements.
186.title: "Trapped"
186.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard has to hide so he won't be caught with a girl, so Pat locks him in the basement.

187.heading: Basements.

notes: Summary: The basement's flooding and Attila can't dog paddle because he's a cat.
